ingre.ingredients: Sprig of fresh tarragon or fennel (optional)

mdir.mdir_steps: Put anise seeds into vodka and steep for 24 hours, turning bottle from time to time to circulate anise.
Strain vodka into a new container.
Decorate with a sprig of tarragon or fennel.
Store in refrigerator or freezer.
Wash leaves and put into bottle for about 24 hours at room temperature.
Remove vodka from leaves.
Store in refrigerator or freezer.
A sprig of basil may be added for decorative purposes.
Scrub cucumber and peel.
Cut into thin, lengthwise strips and put into vodka.
Steep at room temperature for 48 hours, turning bottle occasionally to circulate cucumber.
Strain into new container and store in refrigerator or freezer.
Bruise garlic to release flavor and put into vodka with dill sprigs and a few peppercorns.
Steep for about 24 hours at room temperature, turning the bottle every so often to circulate ingredients.
Strain into a new bottle.
Store in refrigerator or freezer.
A sprig of dill may be kept in the bottle for decorative purposes..

ingre.ingredients: 4 dozen black and white peppercorns, mixed

mdir.mdir_steps: Put peppercorns into vodka.
Peel lemon so that only the yellow, outer peel (zest) is used.
Put into bottle.
Steep for 24 to 48 hours, turning bottle occasionally.
Strain into a new container.
Store in refrigerator or freezer.

mdir.mdir_steps: Mix all ingredients with cracked ice in a mixing glass.
pour into a double Old Fashioned glass.

ingre.ingredients: Large container with tightly fitting lid

mdir.mdir_steps: Add vodka, sugar, and raspberries to large container, cover, and stor in a cool, dark place.
Every week open container and stir well.
After about two months, strain liquid through a fine sieve into a bottle.
Store in refrigerator or freezer.
NOTE: Can be used with any fresh fruit.

Put lime juice and honey into a heat-proof mug.
Add a little boiling water.
Stir until honey is dissolved.
Add scotch.
Warm Drambuie in a small ladle
Ignite.
Pour blazing into mug.
Fill with boiling water.
Stir.
Dissolve honey with lemon juice and a little boiling water in a heat-proof mug.
Add bourbon, rum, curaçao, and a dash of bitters..
Fill mug with boiling water.
stir well.
Stir all ingredients, except créme de cacao, in a large heat-proof mug that has been warmed by a rinsing of boiling water.
Float créme de cacao on top of drink.
Serve immediately.
In a warmed, heat-proof mug, add sugar and a little cider that had been heated to the boiling point..
Stir until sugar is dissolved.
Add cinnamon, cloves, lemon peel, and rum.
Fill with hot cider.
Stir.
Top with butter and grated nutmeg.
Rinse a large, heat-proof mug with boiling water.
Add sugar, cinnamon stick, and a lemon peel studded with cloves.
Pour in enough boiling water to dissolve sugar.
stir in rum.
Fill mug with boiling water.
Place pat of butter on top of drink.
Warm Demerara rum in a ladle.
Add a pinch of sugar, by partially immersing the bowl in hot water.
Ignite rum.
pour blazing into mug.
Add a little additional butter.
Sprinkle with nutmeg.
Beat egg yolk in a small bowl.
add orgeat syrup, ground ginger, and cinnamon, and blend well.
Beat egg white separately in a small bowl until stiff.
carefully fold yolk mixture into a large, warmed mug..
Combine peach brandy, rum, milk, and cream in a small saucepan.
Heat.
Pour into mug while stirring constantly.
Sprinkle with topping of ground nutmeg.
Heat all ingredients, except cinnamon, in a saucepan over low heat.
Stirring from time to time to prevent milk from scorching.
Rinse a heat-proof mug with boiling water.
Fill with hot punch.
Sprinkle cinnamon on top.
Beat egg yolks.
Heat in cream.
Gradually mix in port, using whisk.
Add cognac.
Heat in a saucepan over low heat.
Stir well.
Serve in warmed wine goblets.
Sprinkle with grated nutmeg.
Heat applejack and cider in a saucepan.
stir in honey until dissolved.
Pour into a warmed heat-proof mug.
sprinkle with ground nutmeg and cinnamon.
Garnish with backed apple slice.
Heat all ingredients in a saucepan.
Bring to boiling point, (do not boil).
Serve in a warm mug..
In the flaming pan of a chafing dish mix red wine, curaçao, Maraschino, and honey until honey is dissolved..
Gradually warm wine over direct heat (do not boil).
stir in a lightly beaten egg.
bring to a simmer.
Pour into a warmed, heat-proof mug.
Add lemon slice and pinch of cinnamon.
Pour Kahlua, tequila, and hot coffee into a warmed irish coffee glass.
Stir well.
Top with whipped cream.
Sprinkle of cinnamon.
Heat all ingredients with 2 oz. of water in a saucepan.
Pour into a heat-proof mug.
Rinse a heat-proof mug with hot water.
Add rock and rye, bitters, lemon slice, and cinnamon stick..
Fill with boiling water.
Stir well.
Sprinkle with grated nutmeg.
Prepare soup according to directions.
Heat in a saucepan.
Add gin when simmering, but not to boil.
Add pepper and parsley.
Serve piping hot in a large mug.
Separate egg.
Beat the yolk and white individually.
Fold white and yolk together.
Add syrup.
Put into a warmed heat-proof mug.
Add rum and cognac.
Fill with boiling water.
Sprinkle with grated nutmeg.
Fill warmed cup with hot coffee.
Using an inverted teaspoon, carefully float half of the sambuca on top of the coffee.
Place a sugar cube in a spoon.
pour remainder of sambuca into spoon.
Ignite.
Drip blazing spoon into cup.
Let cup flame for a few seconds.
Stir coffee to extinguish flame.

ingre.ingredients: Peel of half a large orange
2 oz. gold Jamaica or Barbados rum

mdir.mdir_steps: Cut orange peel in a thin spiral.
Moisten, and coat with brown sugar.
Place spiral in a heat-proof mug.
Add about 1/2 oz. of warmed rum.
Flame until sugar is caramelized.
Add remainder of rum, rock and rye, curaçao, and lemon peel.
Fill with boiling water.
Stir well.
Mix with cracked ice in a shaker or blender.
Strain into a balloon glass.

Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with cherry.
Carefully pour each ingredient in the order listed into a large pony glass so that each liqueur floats on the one preceding it.
Pour liquid slowly over the back of a bar spoon that is held inside the glass near the previous ingredient.
Do not mix the layers.
Mix all ingredients with cracked ice in a shaker or blender.
Strain into a chilled Old Fashioned glass.
Mix all ingredients with cracked ice in a shaker or blender.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Mix all ingredients with cracked ice in a shaker or blender.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Layer ingredients in the order given, one on top of the other in a Pousse-Café glass.
Pour liquid slowly over the back of a bar spoon that is held inside the glass near the previous ingredient.
Do not mix the layers.
Mix all ingredients with cracked ice in a shaker or blender.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Mix all ingredients with cracked ice in a shaker or blender.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Mix all ingredients, except pineapple stick, with cracked ice in a blender until smooth.
Pour nto a chilled Squall glass.
Garnish with pineapple stick.
Pour Fernet Branca and orange juice into a chilled double Old Fashioned glass with several ice cubes,.
Fill with club soda.
Stir gently.
Mix all ingredients in a blender until smooth.
Pour into a chilled Squall glass.
Mix all ingredients, except cinnamon sticks, in a saucepan over low heat.
Bring to a simmer.
Serve in warmed mug.
garnish with cinnamon sticks.

ingre.ingredients: 2 scoops vanilla, butter pecan, or coconut ice cream

mdir.mdir_steps: Mix all ingredients, except cinnamon or nutmeg, in a blender.
Pour into a 10-oz. Collins glass.
Sprinkle top with cinnamon or nutmeg.
Mix coffee, cream, chocolate, and cinnamon in a blender until smooth.
Pour into a Squall glass.
Sprinkle with nutmeg..
Mix all ingredients, except cherry, with cracked ice in a blender or shaker.
Pour into a chilled Old Fashioned glass.
Garnish with cherry.
Beat egg with sugar and salt until well blended and smooth.
Spoon into a chilled highball glass.
Add vanilla and a little cold milk.
Stir briskly.
Add remainder of milk.
Stir again.
Top with nutmeg or cinnamon.
Stir all ingredients with several ice cubes in a shaker or blender.
Pour into a chilled highball glass.

ingre.ingredients: 1/4 cup cucumber, peeled, seeded, and finely chopped

mdir.mdir_steps: Mix all ingredients in a blender until smooth.
serve in chilled wine goblets.
Prepare frozen fruit juice according to instruction on cans.
Pour into a chilled punch bowl with a large cake of ice.
Gently stir in ginger ale and lemon-lime soda and sweeten to taste with Piña Colada mix.
Sprinkle punch with cinnamon and nutmeg.
Garnish with banana slices.
Mix in an electric blender until Piña Colada mix is dissolved.
Chill in the refrigerator until cold.
Mix all ingredients, except lemon slice, with cracked ice in a shaker or blender.
Strain into a chilled Old Fashioned glass.
Garnish with a lemon.
In a chilled wine goblet, mix all ingredients, except egg yolk, with a spoon until well blended.
Carefully add egg yolk to glass so that it is unbroken.
Pre-chill all ingredients.
Mix in a blender until smooth.
Serve in a tall, chilled Collins glass.
Add milk and chocolate syrup in a chilled highball glass.
Mix well.
Fill glass with seltzer.
Stir gently.
Serve with an iced-tea spoon and a straw.

ingre.ingredients: 2 tbsp. plain yogurt or sour cream

mdir.mdir_steps: Stir all ingredients, except yogurt, with cracked ice in a mixing glass.
Strain into a chilled Old Fashioned glass.
Top with yogurt or sour cream.
Mix all ingredients, except soda, pineapple slice and cherry, with cracked ice in a blender.
Pour into a tall, chilled Collins glass.
Fill with cold club soda.
Stir gently.
Garnish with pineapple slice and Maraschino cherry..
Mix all ingredients, except nutmeg, with cracked ice in a blender.
Pour into a chilled highball glass.
Sprinkle with grated nutmeg.
Pour ginger ale and grenadine into a chilled wine glass with an ice cube.
Stir gently.
Garnish with orange slice, lemon peel, and Maraschino cherry.
Mix cold orange juice, ice cream, vanilla, honey, and egg in a blender until honey is dissolved and mixture is smooth but not watery.
Pour into a chilled Collins glass.
Sprinkle with cinnamon and nutmeg.
Put cold coffee, syrup, cinnamon, and ice cream into a blender.
Mix for a few seconds until smooth but not watery.
Serve in a chilled wine goblet.
Top with a generous mound of whipped cream.
Sprinkle with nutmeg.
Mix all ingredients, except dill, with cracked ice in a shaker or blender.
Pour into a chilled Old Fashioned glass.
Top with chopped dill.

ingre.ingredients: 1/2 cup maple syrup or sugar syrup

mdir.mdir_steps: Pre-chill all ingredients.
Pour applejack, rum, peach brandy, brandy, lemon juice, and maple syrup into a chilled punch bowl with a large cake of ice.
Stir well.
Pour in soda.
Stir gently.
Garnish with apple slices.
Makes about 45 servings..
Pre-chill all ingredients.
Pour whiskey, brandy, lemon juice and syrup into a chilled punch bowl.
Mix well.
Add a large cake of ice.
Pour in champagne.
Thinly slice some brandied peaches.
Put one slice in every cup of punch
Makes about 37 servings.
Pre-chill all ingredients.
Put red wine, cognac, rum, vermouth, and sugar syrup in a chilled punch bowl with a cake of ice.
Mix well.
Pour in cold champagne and club soda.
Stir gently.
Garnish with a few thinly sliced orange peels.
Makes about 46 servings..
Mix well with ice in a blender.
serve in chilled Old Fashioned glasses.
Makes 30 servings..

ingre.ingredients: 1/2 pt. Batavia Arak or Swedish Punsch

mdir.mdir_steps: Put tea, lemon slices, lime juice, and sugar into the flaming pan of a chafing dish.
Simmer over direct heat until all sugar is dissolved.
Add arak, triple sec, and rum.
Heat but do not boil.
Warm some cognac in a ladle by keeping it partially submersed in the hot punch.
Ignite cognac.
pour blazing into chafing dish.
Extinguish flames.
Pour in remainder of cognac.
Makes about 20 servings..

ingre.ingredients: Brown sugar, maple syrup, or honey

mdir.mdir_steps: In a chafing dish or saucepan put in hot tea, fruit juices, and sugar, syrup, or honey.
Mix until all sweeteners are dissolved.
Add curaçao and rum.
Heat, but do not boil.
Stir well.
Serve in warmed mugs.
Makes 14 cups.
Simmer tea, sugar, and lemon peel in the flaming pan of a chafing dish over direct heat until all sugar is dissolved..
Add port and scotch.
Heat, but do not boil.
Add all cognac to the pan, except several ounces for flaming.
Pour reserved cognac into a ladle.
Warm by partially immersing in hot punch.
Ignite cognac.
Pour blazing into pan.
Extinguish flame with pan lid.
Makes about 17 servings.

ingre.ingredients: 1 cup Grand Marnier or triple sec
1/2 cup orgeat or sugar syrup to taste

mdir.mdir_steps: Mix all ingredients, except champagne or soda and fruitslices, in a large, chilled container or punch bowl.
Cover, and chill in refrigerator for one hour..
Add a large cake of ice to bowl.
Pour in champagne.
Stir gently.
Garnish with a few orange and lemon slices.
Makes about 32 servings..

ingre.ingredients: 1/4 cup maple syrup, honey, or sugar syrup

mdir.mdir_steps: Heat applejack, lemon juice, and syrup in the flaming pan of a chafing dish over direct heat.
Stir until syrup is dissolved.
Add brandy, bitters, cinnamon, and a few pieces of lemon peel.
Stir well.
Ignite.
extinguish flames by adding a little boiling water or close pan lid.
Makes about 8 servings..
Mix all ingredients.
refrigerate for several hours, covered, before serving.
Makes 40 servings..
Chill all ingredients.
Mix in a large punch bowl with a cake of ice.
Add sparkling wine last.
Stir in gently.
Makes about 35 servings..
Prechill all ingredients.
Pour whiskey, Cointreau, lemon juice, orange juice, raspberry syrup, and sugar syrup into a chilled punch bowl with a cake of ice.
Mix well.
Just before serving, pour in champagne and club soda.
Stir gently.
Makes about 37 servings.

ingre.ingredients: 1 750-ml bottle port, Madeira, sherry, or dry red or white wine

mdir.mdir_steps: Rub all of the zest (outside peel) off a lemon until only the white, inner peel showes.
Put sugar cubes in a warmed pitcher.
Add enough boiling water to completely dissolve sugar.
Add spices, some lemon juice, and wine.
Mix well.
When ready to serve, pour in 2 cups of boiling water.
Makes about 10 servings.

ingre.ingredients: 1/2 cup honey, orgeat syrup, or sugar syrup

mdir.mdir_steps: Mix rum, brandy, hot tea, lemon juice, honey or syrup, and curaçao in a saucepan.
Stir until honey or syrup is completely dissolved.
When cool, pour into a large cake of ice.
Garnish with lemon slices.
Makes about 30 servings.
Pour cold orange juice and cherries (with juice) into a pre-chilled punch bowl with a large cake of ice..
Stir well.
Add cold champagne.
Stir gently.
Serve in chilled 8-oz. champagne tulip glasses.
Makes about 24 6-ounce servings.
Clean out a large container with a tight-fitting lid with boiling water.
In a small mixing bowl combine lemon juice, zest, and sugar.
Stir until sugar is disolved.
Pour into large container with brandy and 1 bottle of wine.
Seal the container and store in a cool place for 5 tor 6 weeks.
To serve, strain shrub into a chilled punch bowl with a cake of ice.
Garnish with long strips of lemon peels and several mint sprigs.
Makes about 30 servings..
Pre-chill all ingredients.
Mix in a chilled punch bowl with ice cake.
Add champagne and soda.
Stir very gently.
Stirring constantly until well blended.
Pour mixture from one pitcher to another until frothy.
Makes about 83 servings..

ingre.ingredients: 1 small ripe pineapple, skinned, cored, and sliced thin

mdir.mdir_steps: Place sliced limes, lemons, and pineapple in a large pot with a lid that fits securely.
Spread sugar evenly over the fruit and muddle until sugar is pounded or pressed into the slices.
Pour in cognac, cover, and let stand for 24 hours.
Pour the entire contents of the pot into a chilled punch bowl containing a large cake of ice.
Add chilled peach brandy, tea, rum, and curaçao.
stir well.
Gently stir in cold champagne and club soda.
Makes about 70 servings.

ingre.ingredients: 1 l. bottle brandy, bourbon, or rum

mdir.mdir_steps: Beat yolks with 2 lbs. sugar, ground cinnamon, cloves, and allspice until they are smooth and creamy.
Add rum gradually, stirring constantly.
In another bowl, beat egg whites with a pinch of cream of tartar until soft peaks form.
Beat in remainder of sugar until peaks stiffen.
Carefully fold whites into yolks.
When ready to serve, scald out a Tom and Jerry mug.
Put a ladleful of the batter into a cup.
Add 2 oz. of brandy or bourbon or rum.
Fill with boiling water.
Sprinkle with nutmeg.

ingre.ingredients: 1 750-ml. bottle blended whiskey, scotch, or bourbon
4 oz. sugar syrup, pineapple syrup, or Falernum

mdir.mdir_steps: Chill all ingredients.
Mix together in a large punch bowl with a cake of ice.
Stir well.
Makes about 33 servings.

ingre.ingredients: 3 750-ml. bottles Madeira, sherry, port, or Marsala
4 baked apples, cored but not skinned

mdir.mdir_steps: Put sugar and spices in a saucespan or the flaming pan of a chafing dish over direct heat.
Add a cup or two of water.
Bring to a boil.
Stir well until all sugar is dissolved.
Add wine.
Heat, but do not boil.
Separately, beat egg yolks and egg whites
Fold together
Pour eggs into a warmed, heat-proof punch bowl.
Add the hot wine mixture to the punch bowl a little at a time.
Stir briskly, stirring constantly until all wine has been blended with the eggs.
Add cognac.
Stir again.
Add baked apples.
Makes about 28 servings.

ingre.ingredients: 12 thinly sliced orange and lemon sections

mdir.mdir_steps: Pour hot tea into a saucepan with orange zest.
Let steep until tea cool.
Add sugar or honey.
Mix thoroughly until dissolved.
Stir in spirits and wine.
Chill in refrigerator, covered, for an hour or two before serving in a chilled punch bowl with a cake of ice.
Garnish with orange and lemon sections
Makes about 40 servings.

ingre.ingredients: 1/2 tsp. ground ginger, cinnamon, or allspice
1/2 cup Martinique, Haitian, gold Jamaica, or other aromatic rum

mdir.mdir_steps: Heat ale in a saucepan over low heat.
In a small bowl, beat eggs with rum, sugar, and spices and pour into a pitcher that has been rinsed with boling water.
In a second pitcher, also rinsed with boiling water, pour hot ale from the saucepan.
gradually add to egg mixture.
Stirring constantly until well blended.
Pour mixture from one pitcher to another until frothy.
Makes 4 servings.

ingre.ingredients: 1 cup passion fruit or La Grande Passion

mdir.mdir_steps: Mix all ingredients well in a chilled punch bowl.
Add a large cake of ice.
Let stand for several hours in a cool place or in refrigerator.
Garnish with a few thin pineapple slices.
Makes about 42 servings.
Mix all ingredients, except mint leaves, with cracked ice in a shaker or blender.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with mint.

ingre.ingredients: 1 1/2 oz. light or gold Bacardi rum

Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

Drop peel into glass.

ingre.ingredients: 1 oz. orgeat syrup or simple syrup

mdir.mdir_steps: Mix all ingredients, except pineapple stick, with cracked ice in a shaker or blender.
Pour into a chilled Hurricane glass.
Garnish with pineapple stick.
Mix all ingredients, except soda, in a shaker or blender with cracked ice.
Pour into a 14-oz. Collins glass.
Fill with club soda.
Stir gently.
Garnish with a lime slice.
Mix all ingredients, except whipped cream, with cracked ice in a blender.
Serve in a wine goblet.
Top with whipped cream.
Add ice cubes in a tall Collins glass.
Pour in tequila.
Fill with orange juice.
Top with a float of Damiana.

ingre.ingredients: 1 oz. lemon juice or lime juice

mdir.mdir_steps: Pour tequila, juice, and syrup into a tall Collins glass.
Mix well.
Add cracked ice.
Fill with tonic.
Top with a dash or two of grenadine.
decorate with lime slice.
Mix all ingredients with cracked ice in a shaker or blender.
Pour into a chilled Whiskey Sour glass.
Mix all ingredients, except slow gin, in a shaker or blender.
Pour into a a double Old Fashioned glass.
Float sloe gin on top of drink.
Garnish with an orange slice.
Mix all ingredients in a shaker or blender with cracked ice.
Strain.
Pour into a chilled cocktail glass.
Mix all ingredients, except coconut and cherry, with cracked ice in a shaker or blender.
Serve in a chilled cocktail glass.
Sprinkle toasted coconut on top.
Garnish with a cherry.

ingre.ingredients: Juice of 1/2 large or one small lime

mdir.mdir_steps: Mix tequila, triple sec, and lime juice with cracked ice in a shaker or blender with plenty of cracked ice.
Rub rim of a chilled cocktail glass with a piece of cut lime.
Dip the rim of the glass in a saucer of salt until it is evenly coated.
Strain.
Pour Margarita mixture into glass.
Garnish with a thin slice of lime.
Mix all ingredients with cracked ice in a shaker or blender.
Strain.
Pour into a chilled cocktail glass that has been rimmed with salt.
Put some cracked ice into a double Old Fashioned glass.
Add all ingredients except fruit peel.
stir until mixed.
Squeeze fruit peel over drink
drop peel into glass.
Mix all ingredients.
Strain.
Chill in refrigerator.

ingre.ingredients: 1 1/2 oz. Gran Centenario Plata or Reposado Tequila

mdir.mdir_steps: Mix tequila, Agavero, and lime juice with cracked ice in a shaker or blender.
moisten the rim of the glass with lime juice and dip in salt.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lime slice.

ingre.ingredients: 1 oz. lime juice or lemon juice

mdir.mdir_steps: Mix all ingredients in a shaker or blender with cracked ice.
Pour into a chilled cocktail glass.
Add the vodka, tomato juice, and so in to the metal container.
Fill the glass container with ice, the smaller the cubes the better.
Invert the glass into the metal container.
Shake quickly nine times.
Immediately strain the Bloody Mary into a glass.
Serve with a lime wedge.
Mix all ingredients, except lime slice, in a Collins glass with ice.
Garnish with lime slice.
Mix all ingredients with cracked ice in a mixing glass.
pour into a double highball glass.

ingre.ingredients: Generous pinch oregano or dill or tarragon

mdir.mdir_steps: Mix all ingredients with cracked ice in a mixing glass.
pour into a double Old Fashioned glass.
Mix all ingredients, except celery stalk, with cracked ice in a blender.
Pour into a chilled highball glass.
Add additional tomato juice.
Garnish with celery stalk.
Combine vodka, lemon juice, and seasonings in a Hurricane glass.
Add cracked ice.
Stir well.
Garnish with stalk of celery and wedge of lime.
Mix all ingredients with cracked ice in a double Old Fashioned glass.
Garnish with lemon slice.
Mix all ingredients with cracked ice in a shaker or blender.
Pour into a chilled Collins glass.
Stir vodka and sherry in pitcher with ice cubes.
Strain into a chilled stemmed glass.
Garnish with black olive.
Mix pepper and citron vodkas and vermouth with ice in a small pitcher or mixing glass.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Add jalapeño pepper.
Twist lemon peel over drink.
Drop peel into glass.
Mix vodka and vermouth in a mixing glass with plenty of ice.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with dill pickle.

ingre.ingredients: 2 oz. Bombay Gin or Absolut Vodka

mdir.mdir_steps: Mix all ingredients, except cherry, with ice in a blender.
Pour into a chilled wine glass.
Garnish with cherry.
Stir all ingredients with ice in a pitcher.
Strain into a chilled coctail glass.
Garnish with orange peel.
Stir coffee and vanilla vodkas with a generous amount of ice in a pitcher.
Strain into a chilled Martini glass.
Add coffee beans.
Mix rapidly with plenty of ice in a mixing glass.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a black olive.
Mix vodka and vermouth in a mixing glass with plenty of ice.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a Rolaids tablet.
Mix vodka and sherry with cracked ice in a mixing glass.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Twist lemon peel over drink.
drop peel into glass.
Mix vodka and vermouth in a mixing glass with plenty of ice very rapidly.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with several pickled pearl onions after blotting them on paper towels to prevent residual vinegar flavor affecting the drink.
Stir with ice in a mixing glass.
Serve in a chilled highball glass with ice.
Add lemon.

Stir all ingredients in a Collins glass with ice.
Fill with soda.
Stir with ice.
Strain into a chilled stemmed glass.

Serve in a chilled stemmed glass.
Stir gently.
Stir all ingredients with ice in a mixing glass.

Stir Campari and vodka with ice.
Pour into a chilled Collins glass.

Garnish with orange slice.
Chill ingredients in refrigerator.
Serve in a chilled stemmed glass.
Stir gently.

Fill with soda.

Pour into a chilled wine goblet.
Garnish with orange slice.

Strain into a chilled wine glass.

Pour into chilled Collins glass.
Mix all ingredients with cracked ice in a shaker or blender.
Pour into a tall chilled Collins glass.

ingre.ingredients: Ginger ale, bitter lemon soda, or club soda

mdir.mdir_steps: Pour all ingredients, except soda, into chilled highball glass with ice.
Fill with soda and stir.
Mix all ingredients with cracked ice in a shaker or blender.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Mix all ingredients with cracked ice in a shaker or blender.
Pour into a chilled cocktail glass.
Mix all ingredients with cracked ice in a shaker or blender.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Mix all ingredients with cracked ice in a blender until smooth.
Serve in a chilled wine glass.
Mix all ingredients, except lemon peel, with cracked ice in a shaker or blender.
Pour into a chilled Old Fashioned glass.
Twist lemon peel over drink.
Drop peel into drink.
Mix all ingredients, except grenadine, in a shaker or blender with cracked ice.
Pour into a chilled wine goblet.
Top with grenadine.
Combine vodka, sloe gin, orange juice, and cherries in a blender with cracked ice.
Add ice, continuing to blend until mixture is very thick and smooth.
Pour into sherbert glasses.
Top with kirsch.
Mix salt and sugar and spread onto on a sheet of aluminum foil or wax paper.
Wipe the rim of an Old Fashioned glass with lime wedge.
Roll glass in salt-sugar mixture until rim is evenly coated.
Fill chilled glass with several ice cubes, vodka, and grapefruit juice.
Stir.
Mix all ingredients, except whipped cream and strawberry, in a blender for about 10 seconds until creamy. Do not over mix.
Serve in chilled stemmed glass.
Top with whipped cream.
Garnish with strawberry.
Mix all ingredients, except soda and one large strawberry for garnish, in a shaker or blender with cracked ice.
When mixture is smooth, pour into a chilled Collins glass.
Fill with cold lemon-lime soda.
Add ice cubes.
Garnish with large strawberries.
Mix all ingredients, except raspberry liqueur, with cracked ice in a shaker or blender.
Pour into a chilled Collins glass.
Over the back of a spoon, pour in raspberry liqueur.
Quaff the vodka neat and follow it with a mug of beer,
or Pour the vodka into the beer and drink them together.
Pour vermouth into a chilled Collins glass with several ice cubes.
Add sugar syrup, lime juice.
Stir until sugar syrup is dissolved.
Fill glass with cold club soda.
Stir gently.

ingre.ingredients: 1 1/2 oz. dry vermouth or sweet vermouth
Several dashes Peychaud's bitters, orange bitters, or Angostura bitters

mdir.mdir_steps: Stir briskly with cracked ice in a pitcher or mixing glass.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Pre-chill all ingredients.
Pour cognac into a chilled tulip glass.
Fill with cold champagne.
Float yellow Chartreuse on top.
Mix port, vermouth, and lemon juice with cracked ice in a shaker.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Twist lemon peel over drink.
Drop into glass.
Mix lemon juice and syrup with several ice cubes in a chilled Collins glass until syrup is dissolved.
Add cognac.
Fill with cold champagne.
Stir gently.
Mix all ingredients with cracked ice in a blender.
Pour into a chilled highball glass.
Mix all ingredients, except nutmeg, with cracked ice in a blender or shaker
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Top with a sprinkle of nutmeg.
Stir Dubonnet, gin, and curaçao in a mixing glass with cracked ice.
Strain into a chilled Collins glass.
Add several ice cubes and fill with cold club soda.
Stir gently.
Garnish with orange slice or lemon slice.
Pre-chill cassis and wine.
Mix together in a chilled wine glass.

ingre.ingredients: Dash Angostura bitters or orange bitters

mdir.mdir_steps: Place sugar cube in a chilled champagne tulip glass.
Saturate it with bitters, Fernet Branca, Grand Marnier, and cognac.
Fill with cold champagne.
Garnish with a small strip of orange zest.
Saturate a sugar cube with bitters.
Put into a chilled balloon glass.
Add chilled cognac.
Fill with cold champagne.
Stir gently.
Mix all ingredients with cracked ice in a shaker or blender.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Mix Campari and orange juice in a chilled wine goblet with an ice cube.
Fill with cold champagne.
Mix all ingredients with cracked ice in a shaker or blender.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Mix with cracked ice in a a blender or shaker.
Strain into a chilled wine glass.
Stir with ice in a mixing glass.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Mix vermouth and cassis with ice cubes in a chilled highball glass.
Fill with cold club soda.

ingre.ingredients: Club soda, ginger ale, or lemon-lime soda

mdir.mdir_steps: Mix wine, gin, passion fruit, and curaçao with cracked ice in a shaker or blender.
Pour into a chilled Collins glass.
Add several ice cubes and fill with cold soda.
Stir gently.
Twist orange peel over drink.
Drop peel into glass.
Mix with cracked ice in a blender or shaker.
serve in a chilled wine glass.
Mix all ingredients, except lemon peel, with cracked ice in a blender or shaker.
Strain into a chilled Delmonico glass.
Twist lemon peel over drink.
Drop peel into glass.
